website_summaries.verdict: The Acer XB270HU is a 27-inch monitor that uses In-Plane Switching and G-Sync technologies to deliver a great gaming experience.
pros: Excellent gaming scores in our tests

customer_reviews.title: Backlight Bleed, Yellow Tint, G-Sync Issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought a model a couple of years ago for £550 and it was terrible, like the older reviews say on here. Bought this a month ago and it's currently great and cheaper (£400) Not sure why the price shot up so much but I'd definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this monitor, the colours are so vibrant
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap and they say you get what you pay for and it's true with this product, one thing to make a note of if you are going to buy this monitor the sound from the built-in speakers are rubbish, I knew that before I bought it. You should watch my video as I try and explain the difference between IPS panel and NT panel The one I bought is IPS and that's what gives it such rich colors. I hope this video is helpful for you all.
customer_reviews.author: yorkie247

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Item had at least 3 stuck green pixels, some of which were visible during gaming, and bad backlight bleed enough to ruin darker scenes. Returned for refund. Purchased a 2nd unit. I stopped counting when I got to 21 stuck pixels. It was like multiple constellations on the screen. Shockingly poor QC going on with these monitors. Even at the '"Sale" price of ~£499, this is utterly unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this company specially this monitor!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The monitor started out OK. After a few weeks I started to have an infrequent flickering issue. Now it has been a few months and the issue is becoming annoying. After Amazon's troubleshooting which did not help, I decided to contact Acer directly. The only thing I got from them so far is an email from a "do-not-reply" address asking for more info. I do not know how to respond to them now. I can not recommend this monitor, the flickering appears to be a common issue, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Acer Predator XB271HU Review.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, better than I could have imagined. For once the colour reproduction does not have to be changed out of the box. 1440p is just the right resolution, games run very well on this monitor, it has great aesthetics, it feels like it has great build quality and it does. Very thin bezel is very pleasing to the eye. 27 inches is perfect. The price is much better than the competition. If you're thinking about this or the Asus one, choose this one, because the colour reproduction is much much better, Asus always have the contrast too high and their screens are too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Bern

customer_reviews.title: High refresh wasted on such low quality panels.
customer_reviews.text: On my 2nd Acer Predator xb271hu. The quality is just appalling. It bleeds and glows all around at 24%,brightness. I don't really understand how this is even an IPS panel, it feels suspiciously similar to TN where instead of colors shifting at different angles, the horrid glow just washes out colors. I think i'll try one more and give up. Side by side with my Dell UltraSharp it looks utterly defective. And ontop of all this, the edge bleeding spots are bright enough to always be visible the moment the area goes slightly dark... at 24% brightness. For me, the 165hz refresh does not even come close to offsetting the frankly embarrassing image quality compared to the 60hz ultrasharp.
customer_reviews.author: Bogdan Lalut

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Screen for my Virtual Pinball Machine
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen all round. Brilliant image, brilliant viewing angles and Gsync is a must these days. Can't rate the Acer Predator range highly enough. I also have an X34a which has served me well for almost 2 years now and I would not hesitate to be a customer in the future. ALL IPS screens have 'IPS' glow... but you really do not notice it when its running. If you want to sit and take photos of a black screen with a mobile phone then the issue will be dramatically increased, but for normal use, you won't notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Darren C.

customer_reviews.title: Bleed and glow
customer_reviews.text: 2 replaced monitots and both have horrible bleeding at this price tag monitor should be ideal my old samsung ips has none bleed and solid blacks and almost none glow a Verry dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Klaudijus

customer_reviews.title: Sharp image
customer_reviews.text: Based on first impressions: excellent quality and colour, G-Sync is handy for making 60-80fps feel like 90-120fps. Stand is huge, if you play competitively with your monitor close to your mouse, it may get in the way, but I just have the base at 80 degree sideways to help move the base' feet out of the way. Edit: Ended up replacing the stand for a lower profile one. Got an invision arm which BARELY fits, you really need to squeeze it in, but the room it saves compared to the stock feet is ridiculous. Hate the stand. (VESA 100X100).
customer_reviews.author: Sam Rees

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor some issues
customer_reviews.text: SO the monitor its self is fantastic. Great picture and very nice on the eyes. The issue with the monitor is the firmware for the G-sync if you lucky you get a great monitor if you was like me you get random issues. Blue lines Invisible line down the middle of the screen and flickering. But i think i just got unlucky overall if it did not have them issues would have been the perfect monitor for 1440p and gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out for Backlight Bleeding but Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: So I got this monitor today and the settings definitely need changing to how you like it, for me 1440p and 165hz is the sweet spot and this monitor is the cheapest with IPS, 1440p resolution, g sync and 165hz. It is a great screen although the stand is quite annoying and is a little too big for my desk. The specific monitor I received had a little backlight bleeding in the bottom right corner which is quite annoying for the amount of money you pay and I still haven't decided if im going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Awful customer service from Acer - beware!
customer_reviews.text: The monitor was fine to begin with, but developed some dead lines and corruption randomly on the far left side of the monitor - this was within the first year of ownership. When sent back to Acer, they claimed it wasn't their fault, and quoted £600 to repair it, which was more then the monitor cost. The worst customer support I've ever experienced - especially awful for a so-called premium gamer brand.
customer_reviews.author: J HARBOTTLE

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few months back on the 15th of October. Overall, I've been using it for a couple of months and faced no problems with it. It arrived in perfect condition, was easy to assemble, and looks appealing. Yes, there is a slight Backlight bleed on one corner, however, it is not noticeable at all. I recommend this product to everyone who is searching for a good gaming monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Hameed

customer_reviews.title: Great screen.
customer_reviews.text: Great IPS panel, got this screen for a good deal on sale. If you're looking for a IPS panel with high refresh rate look no further! Bezels are nice and slim which works well when paired with another monitor Unfortunately can't give this a 5* as there is a bit of IPS glow, and a little backlight bleed, but I don't notice it much when using the screen. You also have to fiddle with the settings a bit out of the box to achieve a good colour balance.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you’re willing to change the default colour calibration settings.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a fan of the design of the stand (both the size of it and the aesthetics) or the logo. From my anecdotal experience there’s less backlight bleed than the AOC AG271QG (I bought and returned 3 of them because of excessive backlight bleed before giving up and switching to this monitor), though the trade off is this display is calibrated far warmer and not in a good way. Definitely invest the time to change the colour settings using an .icc profile as the default colour setting has an ugly yellow cast to it. Once that’s resolved it’s fine and I’ve had no other issues with image quality so far after 6 months of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Stunning gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my twitch streaming studio, no issues what so ever, I own a 34” 4K predator to, can not recommend this enough, I don’t understand how there is any bad reviews about such a great monitor. I always leave my honest opinion on all purchases. If you like my review and it’s helped you in any way please give it a thumbs up 👍🏽 Thank you !!!
customer_reviews.author: Stevan H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor (If you get it at a discount)
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's terribly good for gaming but I'm note sure G-sync is worth it anymore with the increased compatibility of FreeSync. I'm not sure if it's worth the extra cost so unless it's discounted I'd say don't get it. Picture quality is ok, but it requires a bit of fiddling to get it right, so far I'm not 100% satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Antonio Santano González

customer_reviews.title: Incredible service and an incredible display once you've set it up.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best monitor I have ever used in my life so far. The 2K IPS display has incredible colours and viewing angles, just make sure you set it up properly in your display settings or nvidia settings. The 165Hz refresh rate can be overclocked to 165 from 150 in the monitor settings using the menu via the buttons on the bottom of the near bezel-free display. I could not recommend this enough. As a bonus, Amazon missed me in the morning but then re-delivered at 5:30pm, so thanks to them for that!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wadey

customer_reviews.title: Great product, really happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Been watching this product for a long time, and have been waiting for the price to be justifiable for me. At the full market price, I didn't feel this was the case and couldn't justify near on £700 for a monitor. However since receiving the product I can not express how pleased I am with it. Size, resolution and aesthetic is all a big plus for me. It delivers in every field, I do however run sound through a alternative source, so the only thing that would mark this down is the audio quality of the built in speakers. But this is always expected on monitors/TVs. This monitor partnered with a decent soundbar and I cannot fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hill

customer_reviews.title: A stunning screen that does what it says on the tin with panache at a very competitive price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic screen that has really transformed the look of my games. The G-SYNC with a max 165 refresh rate means my watercooled GForce 1080 Strix can run at optimum with variable refresh without flicker or tearing. Minimal tweaking to the settings means the colours really pop, blacks are deep, whites clean and the IPS screen has fantastically wide viewing angles. A stunning screen for the price. Star Wars Battlefront II, Battlefield I, Forza Horizon 4 and The Crew 2 all look amazing, the screen really does these games justice. My son's PS4 is connected via HDMI with my computer using the DisplayPort. Easy to switch and both look great.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (IPS Model) as an upgrade from an Asus 1080p 60hz monitor and I am very happy with it. It's got great picture quality, and colours. Has a game mode with 3 settings, with a built in fps counter that can be turned on and off. Super smooth when gaming at 144hz with G-Sync. The monitor itself seems very good quality, nice material and sturdy swith adjustable height and angle. It also has a little hook on the back of the stand for hanging your headphones on.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Cussen Burke

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixel after a month
customer_reviews.text: Amazing colour, refresh rate and viewing angles. The problem is that out of the blue an ugly dead pixel has reared it head in the centre of my beautiful panel. This is not acceptable for the cost of this monitor and luckily i was within the 1 month that amazon will return a product but i am very scared that my replacement may end up doing the same. I will update this review once i have had the replacement for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Too many downsides for such price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Amazing image quality - Gsync works brilliantly Cons: - Mine had to have the deep sleep feature disabled to display GPU output. - Although zeroframe there is a ~5mm gap between the bezel and the display area. - Embedded speakers sound quality is extremely bad on mine. - Mine flickers on Steam launch strangely. - No input auto detection (DP is default FYI).
customer_reviews.author: MikeP

customer_reviews.title: From 485 to 600 in a few months
customer_reviews.text: First off i bought this monitor to have as my primary monitor from a 1080p one and got it since june to see how it holds up. Picture quality is great no dead pixel and no back bleed, however when i bought this it only cost me 485 pound now that black friday is close it rose all the way to 600 wtf dont take advantage of your customers Acer or Amazon pls. Other than that its great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark David

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Three things I don’t like from this monitor: 1. It is expensive. 2. Terrible bleed on the sides of the screen. 3. Screen is too bright. Things I did: 1. Extra shifts to cover the cost. 2. I cannot do anything about the bleed. 3. Lowered the brightness level to 15 and purchased a pair of polarised sunglasses.
customer_reviews.author: GrandHomme

customer_reviews.title: G-SYNC not worth it at all
customer_reviews.text: GSync is not buttery smooth at all. Have tried all recommended configs and with my water cooled GTX 1080 and my old GTX 780 Classified. There is no tearing, true but there is lots of stuttering when playing modern AAA titles like Black Ops 4, AC Origins, Battlefield 1. Also has vertical line issue (almost like a tear) which Acer confirm is a firmware issue and can apparently only be fixed by me paying to ship monitor to them and waiting between 5-10 days which is not a suitable option for me. Amazon sent a replacement and it too has the same issue. Will now be returning this one also for a refund and will buy a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Rugby187

customer_reviews.title: Was lucky, but a great monitor regardless
customer_reviews.text: Only have a little bit of backlight bleeding on each corner, but this is only noticeable when the screen is displaying something pitch black. Even if i did have a little more I would not return it since the display is amazing otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Extremely satisfied with this monitor, it adjusts perfectly and clips into position without any hassle, the stand is also of good quality and the monitor itself is incredibly good, strongly recommend! Edit: Used this monitor for over 2 years now and decided to buy another one, has not given any problems and no sign of tear, works extremely well for gaming and also brilliant for work. To this date, I still highly recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... pixel in the center of the screen and with horrible IPS glow and BLB
customer_reviews.text: Came with a dead pixel in the center of the screen, horribly IPS glow and BLB, awful Quality Control
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IPS Glow Unmanageable
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this monitor however I had to return this due to IPS glow being far too distracting. If you are not playing dark games then this may be for you but games like Resident Evil 7 were unplayable in the dark due to the bright corners in top left and bottom right. Response time was acceptable and the image was gorgeous on brighter games. I understand IPS glow is an issue with IPS monitors in general but for me it was just not acceptable for a monitor around £500.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, just unlucky
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, 180hz feels really nice just i got unlucky with mine. Picture quality is pretty good for a TN panel. Came with a stuck pixel which while it's near the edge of the screen and really doesn't affect anything, it's just annoying knowing its there. The delivery company that it came with "hermes" is terrible too. But that's not the monitor being bad just the trash delivery company. Would probably recommend it at full price, even more so if you pick it up on sale if you play a lot of fps games. If you play more casual games/ story driven games or you're planning on doing photoshop/video editing i'd go for 4k monitor instead or a ips pannel
customer_reviews.author: LMAO u gay

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant performance at this price point as it comes with ...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant performance at this price point as it comes with a high refresh rate bundled with G-Sync. I wouldn't recommend overclocking to 180 Hz as this washes all the colours out and adds lines on the screen if you look closely enough. Also it shows irregularities within the back light when overclocked as some parts of the screen look quite odd. I use this monitor at 144 Hz with G-Sync on and everything's just buttery smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gaming screen.
customer_reviews.text: Great picture with resolution right in the sweet spot. G-sync works well, colour is great, decent refresh rate, no noticeable lag. Such an improvement over my previous screen!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Camble

customer_reviews.title: Flawless display
customer_reviews.text: I know that buying a monitor can be hit and miss sometimes with IPS (in reference to back-light bleed or dead pixels etc), but this one was absolutely flawless, no dead pixels or back-light bleed. Nice colour and brightness out of the box, if a tad on the warmer side - but easily adjusted out. G-sync is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Baskura

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding monitor
customer_reviews.text: Lovely natural colours, sharp low latency & high resolution. Can be cranked up to 165hz but you WILL get annoying ghosting. Only down side is the speakers are pretty pants. Not an issue if you have speakers or use a headset though!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Birks

customer_reviews.title: It will change your life!
customer_reviews.text: There simply is not a better option for my use case!
customer_reviews.author: Bluedevil

customer_reviews.title: No bleed of note or dead pixels and quality excellent (stand is a cheap and naff looking)
customer_reviews.text: Impressive monitor, decided to try one our for 144hz gaming (from 60hz) and cannot see myself going back. No bleed of note or dead pixels and quality excellent (stand is a cheap and naff looking). Only negative is that I run a 2 monitor setup, so my OCD is telling me that I'll need to buy another one to compliment it!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high quality monitor
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect. No problems with pixels or light bleed. Colours are accurate and vivid. Can't think of anything negative to add
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic monitor in my opinion! The image quality and colours are superb and I have definitely enjoyed using this as my new gaming monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: The perfect display upgrade before 4k 144hz HDR 4:4:4 becomes a real thing.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like I received a perfect unit, every pixel is good, absolutely no bleed and glow is below average for IPS standards, I used to have a bad opinion about Acer but this line of products are definitely the best you can find in the market. The IPS panel allows this monitor to be really good on the eye even for office work, colours are great and can be calibrated with accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: A.r

customer_reviews.title: If you don't care about backlight bleed (or are lucky), fantastic monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this monitor is great, except both the units I ordered had crazy amounts of back-light bleeding. You only notice this when it's dark and when the scene itself is dark, but at this price point I think it's unacceptable. The third monitor I got had hardly noticable BLB so I stuck with it. Ignoring that, the monitor is near perfect in my opinion. IPS is definitely worth, not only are colors better but the viewing angles are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Ivaylo Vladimirov Lafchiev

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Excelent, truely excellent, i recently built a pc with a nvidia gtx 1070 and wanted a monitor that can do it justice qnd this really does.
customer_reviews.author: motlias

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best monitor I've used
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment this. The first one that I originally got from Amazon had a dead pixel on it. Luckily they had more stock and replaced it for me without question. Since using the monitor, I'm now the greatest at games.
customer_reviews.author: RobC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent monitor. Advised by computer specialist to get this to use with gaming computer. Perfect crisp graphics
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. A. J. Kapadi

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Capability, reliability and price.
customer_reviews.text: All wants come ticked. Very Good Monitor. Stand outs; The Stand- very sturdy. 27 inch is a lovely size. Picture Quality Superb. Comes Very Well Packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Christopher J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: Made such a differance to my life, being disabled spend all day online, clours great , PVP feels like in there. 4K clours are just eye popping...Quality is expensive but worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: No back light bleed or dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: I was between PG279Q and this one but the Asus monitor's price was cranked from £656 to £698 on the day I was going to purchase so I have decided to look around a little bit more. Then I stumbled upon the XB271HU and decided to go ahead with it as the price was £567 which was within my budget. For all GSync monitors there were happy and not so happy customers in the reviews but my experience with this monitor is crystal clear colours, no back light bleeding or dead pixels. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nevzat Gunay

customer_reviews.title: Faulty screen and no help from customer care
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is faulty. It has some sort of leakage with the LCD making it look there is a still pixel. Highly annoying as I can't stop noticing it even when gaming. And after contacting customer care I was told nothing can be done about it. Very disappointed in all of this as I was really excited about this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I'm not normally one to leave a review so this will be short and sweet. This monitor I can't recomend highly enough and Acer is not normally a brand I associate with monitors so I'm very suprised about the quality. I have yet to force the 165Hz mode as I'm currently enjoying the 144Hz via a Display Port connection. The free Display Port cable is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great colour reproduction, sensible looks (especially if you replace the stand with a standard vesa-compatible arm), minimal bezel, and silky smooth 144-165hz refresh rate with G-Sync.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: great monitor, big difference between my 1080p tn monitor
customer_reviews.text: great monitor, big difference between my 1080p tn monitor.. g-sync and 144hz total awesomeness only problem with this monitor is when playing in a dark room with dark games, that ips glow
customer_reviews.author: Eryl yves

customer_reviews.title: Good picture but with flaws in other areas
customer_reviews.text: You’ll need display port for refresh rates higher than 60Hz. Known issues I’ve encountered are: A line down the centre of the screen (like a mirror image). Switching off and on clears it but it comes back occasionally. If you have been using headphones then you unplug them the built in speakers don’t work. Removing power then turning back on fixes this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 0 issues so far with this monitor. Virtually no Backlight Bleed which is really good! My only quirk with the monitor is the fact that the whites are not white. They are generally pretty yellowish. Other than that great!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, but don't use the overclock
customer_reviews.text: The monitor looks great aesthetically and works perfectly at 144Hz; No issues there. The downside to this monitor is the advertised "180Hz Overclock". Whatever you don't, do not use the overclock. It will completely ruin the experience of the monitor as it washes out the screen and leaves a disturbing and very noticeable grid like pattern (looks a lot like where the G-sync module is located? not sure though, evidence is picture that I have attached). Works nicely without overclock so overall, 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Callum

customer_reviews.title: Great 144hz monitor with optional overclocking to 165hz
customer_reviews.text: Great 144hz monitor with optional overclocking to 165hz. However I have experienced visual bugs when switching to full-screen games, the bug is resolved by resetting the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Bao

customer_reviews.title: The best 1440p gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 Perfect monitor. Amazing picture quality for gaming and streaming services. G-sync works perfectly and games look so much smoother. 1440p is the perfect resolution for desktop gaming. 144Hz and ability to overclock to 165Hz will have your games running and looking great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for a great price, can't go wrong with it's quality.
customer_reviews.author: vercorock

customer_reviews.title: Great 1440p gaming experience @ 144Hz or 160Hz
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, great picture quality, great price. GTX 1080 is good enough to maintain average of 100fps @ 1440p 144Hz with AAA titles like Battlefield V. 1m display port cable included.
customer_reviews.author: K. Plocek

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, let down by quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor itself is great, however Acer’s quality control is not. If an insect is able to get inside the unit because it is not sealed well enough then that should fall under warranty for repairs. However, it doesn’t, even though they shouldn’t be able to get in there in the first place. Things like this shouldn’t happen to a £500+ piece of tech, it’s sad.
customer_reviews.author: Some Scrub

customer_reviews.title: Perfection.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is absolutely phenomenal. I was so wary to spend this money due to the reports of backlight bleed and dead pixel, but let me tell you, my screen is flawless. it has zero BLB or none that i can see anyway. and no dead pixels, the image is incredible and setup is easy, the monitor stand is awesome and sturdy. Gsync and the refresh rate make games run smooth as butter with my GTX 1070. I would never go back to 1080p. If you're on the fence, don't be. This screen is perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Callum

customer_reviews.title: Black Friday Sale deal
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Price at the time, Great screen and perfect for gaming. IPS screen with good refresh.
customer_reviews.author: Leeze

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor. Buy on sale. Minimal back light bleed.
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. Fantastic upgrade. Definitely worth the price on sale. Small issue of back light bleed in bottom left corner but not enough to bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Made a change from a 22 inch 1050p 60hz monitor. It's is life changing.The monitor is beautiful with nice colors and is very smooth when gaming with g-sync and 165hz, I had no IPS glow neither did I have backlight bleed, I guess I came in lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Drift

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor. Great price. Missing accessories though.
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was great. The stand was easy to install and it's quality is nice and sturdy. The picture of the monitor is fantastic. The only negative experience that I had was that the HDMI cable that was suppose to come with the monitor was missing.
customer_reviews.author: Yordan

customer_reviews.title: Finally A good monitor. Amazing colours and super bright
customer_reviews.text: Finally A good monitor. Amazing colours and super bright. negligible back light bleed if any and zero dead pixel so far. I would improve it by removing the down bezel with more conservative logo.

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet!
customer_reviews.text: What a superb gaming monitor, like it a lot, one wee glitch the overclocking is a bit unstable in my older older games but I happily run it at 144 and still pleased.
customer_reviews.author: smokeysco

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor. Although expensive, it certainly makes up for it. I’ve overclocked mine to 165 hertz and it’s silky smooth. Blows me away with the clarity. The build quality is good with little thoughtful design aspects like the headphone stand on the back and the cable management support. Stand is strong and not going anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, very good monitor with very good colours.
customer_reviews.text: 1440p for a 27inch monitor is the sweet spot I think, 1080p is too low of a resolution but most PCs can't push 4k at a good frame rate. The 144hz G sync means that games feel very smooth, even moving the cursor around the desktop feels infinitely better. Be warned, once using this you won't be able to go back to 60hz.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screen
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant screen, great visual quality, in built speakers the only real down side, very quiet and poor quality. Recommend external speakers for a much better sound option but only downside with this screen.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bukieda

customer_reviews.title: Simply brilliant
customer_reviews.text: No light bleed. No ips glow. This monitor is amazing Looks like I’m happy for the next few years Picture quality is outstanding ThAnk you very much Amazon.
